Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2012 11:46PM Mom2Tots wrote: Hi, Best wishes to you with whatever center or doctor(s) you choose.  That said, I was treated at MDA this past year.  I had chemo in NY but had a MX and rads @ MDA.  I went  there because I was moving from NY to TX.  I was diagnosed just as I started to prepare to move.  Because my case was more advanced, I decided to delay the move and start treatment via neoadjuvant chemo. I wasnt exactly impressed with MDA.  Lots of stupid mistakes like what you describe in your post.  In my opinion there was always an excuse.  Don't get me wrong, I am alive and cancer free. Glory be to Jesus. And, I met some great people.  I just wasnt that impressed overall.  In my mind, I would have received comparable treatment in NY.  And, here's another kicker.....the PS at MDA didnt offer/recommend a DIEP for me.  She was going to do a TRAM.  After two consultations with other PSs, I ended up having a contralateral MX and bilateral reconstruction @ NOLA.  Now NOLA...they are impressive!!!!  Their work, their support staff, and their facility is top notch.
